page.title: 08ARNCLIFFE SPORTS AND FETE
page.content: Every year Littondale holds a Fete on the first Saturday in August. A local band leads the children's fancy dress through the village to the field. In the Village Hall there is a flower arranging competition, and miniature garden and vegetable animal competitions for children. On the field are stalls selling a variety of things and refreshments. There are children's races, demonstrations and competitions. The high-light of the day is the fell race. The route taken for this race is quite strenuous, climbing to the top of the fell, before returning to the field in the valley bottom. A clay pigeon shooting competition also takes place in a field away from the main Fete. The funds raised at the Fete help with the upkeep of the Village Hall.
